cyclone.name: ARTHUR
cyclone.current_location: about 345 miles south-southwest of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northeast, expected to curve northeast and pass near or just east of the North Carolina Outer Banks before accelerating seaward into the Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Outer Banks of North Carolina (near Cape Hatteras) – likely a coastal brush rather than an inland landfall

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch/Warning in place from Surf City to Duck, NC including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds
weather_observation.warning_coast: Surf City to Duck, NC including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: East-central Florida waters northward to the North Carolina coast, with greatest impacts expected along the Outer Banks
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts 20–30 mph possible; low chance of sustained 34 kt winds at the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected (surge heights below 3 ft for east-central Florida).
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of rain could bring 1–2 inches locally; widespread heavy totals not expected.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along the Space Coast beaches could disrupt small-craft and cruise operations.
